Complementary chips with some absolutely delicious salsa/sauce? to start. Ran out of chips and asked if it would be possible to get more & the enthusiastic server said "I can make that happen". Unfortunately, it never became a reality. 

Next ordered some olives and bread and cheese to start, but lo and behold, they're out the cheese. Really?  Ok. Got the pickled vegetables instead, which were delicious but running out of cheese!?!?

Ordered the arugula salad, shrimp, duck & piri piri chicken to round things out. Have to say, the waiter was great about the wine rec cuz I was clueless about Portuguese wine.  Shrimp cane first and was solid. Salad was sublime. Dunno if they added sugar to the dressing but the full tilt sweetness counter-balanced against the bitterness of the arugula was amazing on top of the pears & cheese. 

Duck never came so can't comment on that. Chicken was good for roast chicken but no clue what piri-piri glaze is supposed to taste like & especially bummed cuz the term was thrown out in the TV series "Looking" & I was like what is that. 

On to dessert. Ordered all 3 but again out of the pear almond tart. Almond oil cake = meh & Portuguese custard tarts were a vague whiff of what they have in Macau or even LA. 

Overall- more than happy to return if they can get the house in order.
author: Lee Y.

description: Delicious and so close to home. Their small plates are perfect to get a sense of the flavors in this restaurant. The olive oil cake was absolutely delightful. I'll definitely be back. The short ribs are calling my name!
author: Michelle D.

description: Great atmosphere and the variety of dishes were all great! I came with a small group so we shared small dishes and a couple larger plates. The salt cod we had a second order of! Service was great, with helpful descriptions of the dishes and of the wine. By the end of our dinner service got a little slower but the place was also filling up. Can't wait to come back!
author: Hannah H.

description:
I was not sure what to expect.  First,
I recently went to Portugal and was not in love with the cuisine and second, the previous Incanto in this space was not my favorite. I live on Church Street. We yearn for more good restaurants in the neighborhood! So I went with my foodie friends tonight and it was SUPERB!  The restaurant was packed and festive, great atmosphere (unlike the previous iterations), the food was delicious (everything--salad with port vinaigrette, duck with risotto cakes, the seafood and meat main courses were yummy.....).  Literally day 3 of this restaurant and they had the food and service going like they'd been there for a year.  Very impressive.  I can't wait to go back!  We had a white Portuguese wine and we brought our friend's red wine from Portugal (Solar Dos Lobos).  Yummy! All good!
author: Barbara M.

description: Being of Portuguese descent, we decided to try this new restaurant out. We went about half an hour after they opened. They weren't busy, but that sure changed within about 20 min. (We left and there we're still people waiting.) Had the caldo verde first and it was pretty good. Then I had the Alcatra. Very tender meat and very flavorful - so good!  The only negative was it could have been hotter (temperature wise). Had the pear and almond tart for dessert - a definite winner!  Topped it all off with an espresso which was good, but again, not hot enough. The red wine we had with our was really good as well. I didn't order it, so I don't know which one it was.  Overall, it was a good experience and definitely worth another visit!
author: Lena P.

description: Fresh food. Oysters are really good. Nice & cosy ambience, family friendly. We'd definitely come back
author: Irina S.

description: This place is relatively new so we thought we would try it.   Entering their were only 4 tables dining with lots of empty seats.  We were greeted by the hostess who asked us if we could eat and finish within 1 hr to 1 hr 15 mins.  Because there were other reservations.  Not enough to fill the place but would allow for walk insLooking at the a la carte menu it was 23 to 28 per main entree.  Price was no object but we were not going to be rushed through a 4 course meal and eat like pigs for their benefit.  We will not be back and good luck keeping your doors open
author: K J.

description: Really great atmosphere. We were a group of four, and opted to eat family-style. We ordered a bunch of appetizers, small plates and large plates. The food came out at different times which gave us a chance to talk and digest. It was fantastic. The wines were primarily Portuguese,  which gave us a chance to try something different. The place falls short of 5 stars only on service. Although well-intended, staff were flustered (this was a Saturday evening) trying to turn over tables and get recently arrived guests seated. This led to some delays, and a couple of forgotten drinks orders, but it didn't stop us from having a great time. Would recommend.
author: David C.

description: Delicious and authentic Portuguese food. We loved the octopus and the piri-piri chicken. Our waiter did a fantastic job making recommendations on wine and the customer service was top notch.
author: Amber M.

description:
I looked forward to dinner at this new highly acclaimed restaurant but it did not live up to the hype.   We had an early Tuesday night reservation and were seated timely and served a bowl of home made chips and pepper sauce that were delicious.   Sadly, that and the wine was the best thing we had all night.   I ordered a Salada de Rucula that proved to be a large plate of arugula with a few apple slices, cheese and almonds.   It would have been fine for a lunch, but the amount of arugula was simply too much to balance out the other ingredients and to serve as a starter.   That was followed by the Salada de Mariscos that was a few octopus bits, a mussel, a shrimp and a lot of garbanzo beans.  This dish was simply too salty to eat and my dinner companion and I both passed on it.   We then split the Robalo and the fish was beautifully cooked.   Unfortunately, it was also served with a whole lot of garbanzos that were quite hard.   I  thought maybe i just didn't know how they were supposed to be eaten but when my diner companion bounced two off the table, we gave up on them.   Still being hungry, we ordered the Portugese custard tart for dessert.   It was baked to within an inch of its life and so tough that it could not be torn apart, much less cut.  

My rating would have been two stars had it not been for the extremely nice and competent staff.   They took the Robalo off the bill because of the hard garbanzos.  Whether it is an inability to deal with the sudden popularity and crowds or just an off night I can't say.   This was a second visit for my dinner companion who had quite good things to say about her first visit and was equally disappointed this time.   Maybe we will try it again but not anytime soon.
author: Linda V.

description: Celebrated my birthday tonight at Uma Casa with family.  The entire meal was delicious, starting with the "snacks" of shrimp turnovers, cold fritters, the grilled Monterey sardines, moving on to the oysters, salad de Moriscos, salad da terra, and finishing with braised short ribs, and grilled half Mary's chicken.  The service was exceptional, and we never waited more then 3 min before the next course was served.  Telmo the chef and owner welcomed us when we came in, and made us feel at home by coming to the table twice, making sure the food was meeting our expectations.
author: Cathy B.

description: Uma Casa is the AMAZING!  No other words can describe it.  The decor, the staff, the food.  We had a birthday celebration at Uma Casa and they made us feel like we were at home.  Our waiter Pablo was great. He was friendly and made sure we had everything we needed.  The food OMG was Delicious.  Its like my Mae (mom) or Avo (grandma) would make, but better (but told tell them that).  The Caldo Verde soup to die for, the pork with clams out of this world, the bachalu a gomes sa(cod with potatoes) amazing. From the appetizers to the entrees no complaints.   I went to bed dreaming of this food.  Good portions too you definitely  leave out of there full and satisfied . Easy to get there also . Parking is on street but we found a park pretty easy.    A MUST go .  Definitely worth the drive from anywhere.  We all came from San Jose.  I will go there again.  Congratulations Chef Telmo Faria this place is great
author: Annette N.

description: New favorite restaurant! This place is so great, that I've been back twice this week. A modern Californian take on Portuguese classics.
author: Jordan N.

description: This is a great find! We had a fabulous dinner at the bar last Friday.  The staff is amazing and helpful and the food is delicious.  I loved the citrus salad with beets and parsnips - really amazing and so beautiful we took a picture (which I never do). The atmosphere is welcoming and bustling but quiet enough to have a conversation.  I will definitely go back!
author: Sandy B.

description: Amazing new Portuguese restaurant in the neighborhood!  I haven't been to Portugal yet so I was unfamiliar with the menu and cuisine but I am a believer now, I may even have to add Portugal up on my travel list. We had the duck rice(I forget the actual names) and fish stew, both were amazing! Our waiter Pablo was so welcoming, funny and attentive!  And the chef/owner even stopped by our table just to say hi!  Super nice guy and a great chef! We will be back!
author: Eric S.

description: REMARKABLE. Found this new spot through a friend who told me I had to try it and he couldn't be any more right! The inside is beautiful but that's just the beginning. Ordered a couple of appetizers (you CAN'T miss the shrimps) and a main course and as a Spaniard it made me travel back to the Iberian peninsula. Definitely coming back!
author: Z W.

description: Great addition to the neighborhood. The staff was friendly and had excellent recommendations. The food was delicious (especially the duck) and wasn't over priced. Definitely worth a visit!
author: Caitlin H.

description: We didn't have a reservation but were accommodated at the community table. The appetizers were well prepared and presented beautifully. The seafood salad with white beans was loaded with flavor as well as the beet salad. The salted cod baked with onions and potatoes and egg slices on top was beautifully presented and the dish came together perfectly. Good atmosphere, able to talk w/o shouting. The only complaint was the stools at the community table...very uncomfortable!!! Definitely would go back. Want that salt cod recipe. Amazing!
author: Jean E.
